habitat_description:
Eumetopias jubatus rookeries are typically on exposed rocks, slabs, or cobble beaches (Call and Loughlin, 2005; Ban and Trites, 2007), though occasional rookeries are established on sandy beaches (Call and Loughlin, 2005). Haulout sites include jetties, offshore rocks, coastal islands, and navigation buoys (Jeffries et al., 2000). The species avoids tidal flats and marshes (Ban and Trites, 2007).

Steller sea lions are found up the Columbia River as far as Bonneville Dam (Stansell et al., 2010; Brown et al., 2011).
